atst.giss.abplc

Class PlcTagReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • atst.giss.abplc.PlcTagReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PlcTagReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is used to read a specific PLC tag at a specified interval.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected PlcTagReader(ABPlcioChannel ch, PlcTag tag, double interval, java.lang.String logCatSuffix, <any> plcioErrorIHandler, <any> readTagIHandler)
      Construct a PlcTagReader.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlcTagReader

        protected PlcTagReader(ABPlcioChannel ch,
                       PlcTag tag,
                       double interval,
                       java.lang.String logCatSuffix,
                       <any> plcioErrorIHandler,
                       <any> readTagIHandler)
        Construct a PlcTagReader.
        Parameters:
        ch - The open channel to the PLC to be used to read the PLC tag.
        tag - The PLC tag to be read on each run of the thread.
        interval - The read interval in seconds at which the thread should run.
        logCatSuffix - The suffix to be added to the PlcTagReader's log category prefix to create the log category string used in all log messages.
        plcioErrorIHandler - The interrupt handler to be called if a PLCIO error occurs when reading the tag.
        readTagIHandler - The interrupt handler to be called following read of the tag - null if no interrupt is to be called.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()

      • getLogCatInUse

        public java.lang.String getLogCatInUse()
        Return the CSF log category in use by this PlcTagReader.
        Returns:
        The log category in use.

      • isTagRead

        public boolean isTagRead()
        Return whether the tag has been read.
        Returns:
        true if the tag has been read. false if the tag has not been read.

      • stop

        public void stop()
